H0.text: Simple diffusion is the type of diffusion that allows small hydrophobic molecules to squeeze through lipid molecules.

H1.text: Difficult is the kind of diffusion that allows small hydrophobic molecules to squeeze through lipid molecules.

H2.text: Slippery is the type of diffusion that allows small hydrophobic molecules to squeeze through lipid molecules.

H3.text: Complex is the kind of diffusion that small hydrophobic molecules squeeze through lipid molecules.

A4.text: Lipid bilayers are generally impermeable to ions and polar molecules.

A5.text: Small molecules and ions such as carbon dioxide (CO2) and oxygen (O2) can move across the plasma membrane by diffusion
